articles.title: Trump claims the US is about to get a tremendous fee for taking TikTok out of China
articles.description: A 10 percent stake in Intel, 15 percent of Nvidia’s China sales, a “golden share” of Nippon Steel — what price will Trump extract next in exchange for favorable treatment? Well, The Wall Street Journal is reporting that the Trump Administration is “expected to collect a multibillion-dollar fee” in exchange for negotiating a US takeover […]
articles.author: Sean Hollister

articles.title: Windows 11 is adding another Copilot button nobody asked for
articles.description: Have enough Copilot buttons in your life? No you don’t — have another one! This one pops up in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview when mousing over an open app in your taskbar; it lets you share the contents with Copilot Vision. Want to know who is celebrating in that dogpile on the mound, […]
articles.author: Terrence O’Brien

articles.title: Ex-Disney CEO Michael Eisner calls the FCC’s threats ‘out-of-control intimidation’
articles.description: Michael Eisner, Disney's former CEO who ran the company for 21 years and oversaw its acquisition of ABC in 1995, does not think his successor, Bob Iger, made the right decision in moving to put Jimmy Kimmel Live! on indefinite pause following threats from Trump-appointed FCC chairman Brendan Carr. In a post to X about […]
articles.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

articles.title: Microsoft is raising prices on Xbox consoles in the US again
articles.description: Microsoft is raising the prices of its Xbox Series S / X consoles in the US next month. The Xbox Series X will be priced at $649.99 in the US starting October 3rd, up from its existing $599.99 price. The Xbox Series S will move to $399.99, up from $379.99. Microsoft blames the price hikes […]
articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.title: I know why Mark Zuckerberg risked live demo failure
articles.description: ​​On Wednesday evening, I had a profound sense of déjà vu. When I watched Mark Zuckerberg open his Meta Connect keynote by giving the world a live backstage tour from his new glasses, I was transported back to 2012. I was in the live audience at Google I/O when Sergey Brin introduced the world to […]
articles.author: Sean Hollister

articles.title: It's new iPhone day, so grab some screen protectors for just $4.49
articles.description: Happy iPhone Day! If you’re picking up the new iPhone 17 or iPhone Air and want to avoid scratches or cracks on its front glass, we spotted a great deal on a two-pack of amFilm’s OneTouch screen protectors over at Slickdeals. Designed specifically to fit the front of the new 6.3-inch iPhone 17, you can […]
articles.author: Sheena Vasani

articles.title: Ugreen’s new super slim wallet tracker has 5 years of battery life
articles.description: Ugreen has released a new wallet tracker that’s just as thin as the FineTrack Slim Smart Finder the company debuted earlier this year, but with a massive boost in battery life from 12 months to five years. However, while the previous version was compatible with Apple’s Find My network and recharable, the new FineTrack Slim […]
articles.author: Andrew Liszewski

articles.title: So… is there a TikTok deal or not?
articles.description: China and the US have “made progress” on granting permission for ByteDance to sell TikTok to an American consortium, fulfilling a nine-months-overdue legal requirement. After saying a tentative deal had been reached Monday and that approval would come Friday, President Donald Trump’s administration has issued an update that leaves the current status ambiguous and the […]
articles.author: Adi Robertson

articles.title: MAGA influencers are already fighting over Charlie Kirk’s death
articles.description: The only true surprise about this latest MAGA influencer civil war is how quickly it happened, given the circumstances: Charlie Kirk, an ubiquitous presence, influential political force, and seemingly everyone's best friend, had been dead for barely a week before everyone began fighting each other for a piece of him. The indictment of Tyler Robinson, […]
articles.author: Tina Nguyen

articles.title: ESPN and Fox One net one million signups in under two weeks
articles.description: It feels like we’ve reached total saturation when it comes to streaming services, but apparently people are happy to sign up for one (or two) more services if they include live sports. According to Antenna, a firm that tracks the streaming industry, the new ESPN service and Fox One signed up about a million new […]
articles.author: Terrence O’Brien
